alert.note: Alert for Modoc County Except for the Surprise Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 02 at 3:52AM PDT until September 02 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND AND LOW RH FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 285... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR STRONG GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RH FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 285... The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Saturday afternoon through Saturday evening. * AFFECTED AREA... -In NorCal...All of fire weather zone 285 is in the Red Flag warning for today. The central and southeast portions of fire weather zone 285 are in the Fire Weather Watch for Saturday. * WIND...Southwest winds 15 to 30 mph with gusts to 50 mph today. West to southwest winds of 10 to 20 mph with gusts of 35 mph possible on Saturday. * HUMIDITY...6 to 13 percent. * DETAILED URL...View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. These conditions promote rapid spread of fire which may become life threatening. Evacuate if ordered to, or if a fire threatens. If you have not packed your evacuation kit yet, now is the time to do so. This includes items like important documents and essentials you cannot live without. Fill your vehicle`s fuel tank. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information.

area.areaDesc: Modoc County Except for the Surprise Valley
